meanings.definition: The state or quality of being timid.
meanings.sent1: Her timidities often held her back from trying new things.
meanings.sent2: His timidities were evident in his hesitant body language.
meanings.sent3: Despite her timidities, she managed to speak up during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The timidities of the rabbit made it an easy target for the fox.
meanings.sent5: The timidities of the mouse were no match for the boldness of the cat.

meanings.sent1: The timidities of the children were noticeable in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: She overcame her timidities and delivered a confident speech.
meanings.sent3: The timidities of the puppy made everyone smile at its shyness.
meanings.sent4: His timidities were like shadows following him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The timidities of the deer made it freeze in fear when it saw the hunter.
